question: Some people believe that governments should make the ​investment in building public libraries in every town, while others think it is a waste of money because we have access to information via the Internet. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
text: Meanwhile many individuals have believed that governments should require to make public libraries in every rural areas although others also have seen that it is useless due to the trend of internet use. In general, there could have a lot things to consider with this statement however the following are my views of point about this topic.

To commence, to begin with, we could not deny the fact that on these times that there are a lot of people who still choose to read books in a quiet place. However, library has been a conducive place for learning ever since because of the availability of books and its ambiance. And i think it is a good investment of the government to make his people knowledgeable and well informed about a lot of things in the most convenient and inexpensive way of learning. Moreover, it is convincing to every individual to read books if this will open 24 hours and 7 days a week.

While on the other side, it is true that are rising of modern technologies nowadays and getting online, everything could be possible. Internet has been indispensable since it was invented and it comes through line or wireless connection. Through this, we could access a lot of information like recent research and discoveries, current events, newest fashion trends, weather forecast, etc. Aside from that, this could be used in the most convenient way, anytime and anywhere you want as long you have connections.

To conclude, both parts are important however as i see it will never be useless investment to build libraries in every public places. Although we have internet it still up to every individual how they will make use both of them for learning.

error_list.error_des: The singular quantifier every is followed by the plural noun areas. Consider changing the noun to the singular or using a different quantifier.
It appears that you are missing a preposition after a lot. Consider adding a preposition.
The noun phrase library seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The spelling of ambiance is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
The pronoun I should always be capitalized.
The verb are does not seem to agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
The noun phrase Internet seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It appears that through line is missing a hyphen. Consider adding the hyphen(s).
The pronoun I should always be capitalized.
The noun phrase useless investment seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that places may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The word it doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that you are missing a verb. Consider adding it.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
